intro: Corynanthe ituriensis, commonly known as the Ituri corynanthe, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its restricted habitat and limited study, it remains a less commonly known species within its family.
